summary: The Meiji Restoration in 1868 was a big change for Japan. It put the Emperor back in charge, giving him real power. Before, emperors were just figures. This event also started a new era called Meiji. During this time, Japan changed a lot. It copied Western ideas and became a modern, industrialized country. The new government wanted to make Japan stronger and better, as promised by Emperor Meiji in the Charter Oath.
title: Meiji Restoration
